Description: Mages are powerful spellcasters who gain their powers through either study or ust pure talent.
Weapons: You are Trained in a Weapon Category of choice (e.g. 1-Handed Melee, 2-Handed Ranged, etc).
Proficiency Requirements: You have Proficiency in General Knowledge, Arcane and a number of extra Proficiencies equal to your Intelligence.

~Proficiency in General Knowledge~.Effect: Add your Level to all Intelligence Checks for knowing various simple facts about science, astronomy, trades, etc.

~Proficiency in Arcane~.Effect: Add your Level to all Checks related to magic (e.g. identifying spells, magic items or runes, knowledge about magic, etc).

Mana.Regain: You regain all Mana back when you Long Rest.

Spellcasting.Change: You can change your known Spells (not Talents) when taking a Long Rest.
Spellcasting.Other: All Mage-specific Abilities are considered Spells (except Magic Mastery).

~Magic Mastery~.Effect:
The next ability you use that has the cost of 1 Action now costs a Half-Action.
This is not considered a Spell.

Starting Abilities Description.Magic Mastery:
Magic Mastery can convert a Spell from a Half-Action to 1 Action.
You can use this twice per turn or multiple times per turn to dish out a lot of spells in quick succession, in a single turn.
It is not considered a Spell because some other Mage abilities affect Spells specifically, so Magic Mastery is unaffacted by them.

Specializations.Description: At Level 1, you can choose your specialization. Every Mage can choose from the following Mage specializations
Choices: Sorcerer, a born user of magic, floating with the hard to control magic itself
Wizard, who became a master of magic through intense study, and carries its spells in an indispensible tome
Artificer, who is dedicated to creation, research and experimentation with magical potions, scrolls and magical items!

~Charisma Caster~.Effect: You can freely use Charisma as your Main Stat, if you choose to do so.

~Innate Magic~.Effect: When you cast a spell, if it's different than the previous spell you casted, the previous spell goes on a Long Rest Cooldown, even if it does not have a Cooldown by default.
~Innate Magic~.Notes: Example: 3 turns in a row, you cast Fire Bolt; next turn, you cast Magic Missiles; after this, you can't cast Fire Bolt again until the next Long Rest.

~Overcharge~.Effect:
After you cast a spell the 3rd time in a row, your next ability benefits from Magic Mastery.
After this, that spell becomes goes on a Long Rest Cooldown (and can't be used until the next Long Rest).

<Eldritch Specialization>.Effect: You gain access to the Eldritch Spell List, and when you cast an Eldritch Spell, you can choose to split the d8's into 2d4's and d12's into 2d6's.
<Eldritch Specialization>.Notes:
For example, if a Spell deals 2d8 damage, that becomes 4d4.
it might sound like the same thing, but because of math, 4d4 is actually, on average, 1 extra damage compared to 2d8.

<Wild Cast>.Effect:
Roll 1d6 and 1d8. This spell has the effect of the 2 combined rolls.
For the 1d6:
1. Attack a target for 3d6 Fire Damage
2. A target must pass a Dexterity Check or take 2d8 Cold Damage (or half if it passes).
3. Target all Units in a 4x4 area. Attack them all for 2d6 + 2 Shock Damage.
4. Two Units instantly take 6 Force Damage.
5. Attack all units in a 6x1 line from your position for 4d4 Pierce Damage.
6. One Unit you choose takes 1d10 Force Damage and is pushed 3 meters away from you.
For the 1d8:
1. Nothing else happens.
2. Target(s) all take an extra 2d6 Damage (directly, ignoring Defense) of the damage type of the 1d6 effect.
3. Target(s) must pass an Dexterity Check or be Rooted.
4. Target(s) must pass an Dexterity Check or be Crippled.
5. Target(s) must pass an Intelligence Check or be Silenced.
6. Target(s) must pass a Sense Check or be Feared.
7. Target(s) must pass a Sense Check or be Fleeing.
8. Target(s) must pass a Might Check or be Stunned.

<Wild Magic>.Effect:
Whenever you spend Mana, roll 1d12.
If you roll 12, something wild happens!

<Arcane Comet>.Effect:
Shoot a comet that changes in power the longer it travels - it deals damage and Crowd Controls a target.
It attacks for 1d4 Force damage for every meter it travels (up to 8d4) (all against Defense).
However, the longer it travels, the weaker it's Crowd Control is.
Apply the following Crowd Control (directly, without a Check) to the target depending on the distance traveled (distance between you and the target):
- 1 or 2 meters: Stun
- 3 or 4 meters: Fleeing
- 5 or 6 meters: Root
- 7 or 8 meters: None

<Star Burst>.Effect:
Declare up to 4 different targets within 15 meters.
Assign a different number from #1 to #4 to each.
Roll (3 + Main Stat) d4's. Each number deals that much Shock damage to the target with that number.
Each rolled 1 deals 1 damage to target number #1.
Each rolled 2 deals 2 damage to target number #2.
And so on.
<Star Burst>.Notes:
E.g. if you put #2 on a goblin, and you roll three 2's on the d4's, then that goblin takes 6 Force damage.
You should probably assign the higher number to the target you want to do most damage to.
You can declare fewer targets, but then the missing number will deal damage to no target.
Cover is applied normally.

<Honorificabilitudinitatibus>.Effect: Your single-target Spells that deal half damage when a target passes a Check now deal the full damage regardless.
<Honorificabilitudinitatibus>.Notes: That means spells like Acid Burst don't even require a Check anymore.

~Spell Book~.Effect:
You have a special Spell Book.
Each Long Rest, you can Learn one extra Spell you can Know that costs 1 Mana.
You can cast this Spell once until the next Long Rest, without using Mana.
~Spell Book~.Notes: You should tell your party and Game Master what Spell you chose ahead of time.

~Magic Expertise~.Effect: You can cast Level 4 spells from Level 1, and Level 8 spells from Level 4.

<Counterspell>.Effect: When a Unit you can see casts a Spell, cancel it. It loses the Action (but not the Mana or Cooldown).

<Conjuration Specialization>.Effect: Whenever you spend any amount of Mana on a Conjuration Spell, gain Shielding equal to your Main Stat.

<Arcane Specialization>.Effect: Whenever you spend any amount of Mana on an Arcane Spell, shoot a magic missile at a target within 10 meters that instantly deals 1d4 Force Damage.

<Eldritch Specialization>.Effect: You gain access to the Eldritch Spell List, and when you cast an Eldritch Spell, you can choose to split the d8's into 2d4's and d12's into 2d6's.
<Eldritch Specialization>.Notes:
For example, if a Spell deals 2d8 damage, that becomes 4d4.
It might sound like the same thing, but because of math, 4d4 is actually, on average, 1 extra damage compared to 2d8.

<Force Pulse>.Effect: All enemies within 10 meters must pass a Might Check or be knocked Prone and take 1d4 Force damage.

<Crystal Mage>.Effect:
You become a Crystal Mage.
All your spells that deal Fire, Cold or Force damage now deal a special type of damage, Crystal damage.
You also get the following Crystal Abilities.
<Crystal Mage>.Notes: Almost no creature has resistance or immunity specifically to Crystal damage.

<Battle Mage>.Effect:
While you have an even number of Mana points, your first melee weapon attack each turn deals an extra 1d6 Fire or Cold damage (your choice).
This can only happen if you're wearing Heavy Armor or a Shield.
You also get either Training in Shields, or one free Technique Feat of choice.

<Arcane Comet>.Effect:
Shoot a comet that changes in power the longer it travels - it attacks and Crowd Controls a target.
It deals 1d4 Force damage (against Defense) for every meter it travels (up to 8d4).
However, the longer it travels, the weaker it's Crowd Control is.
Apply the following Crowd Control (directly, without a Check) to the target depending on the distance traveled (distance between you and the target):
- 1 or 2 meters: Stun
- 3 or 4 meters: Fleeing
- 5 or 6 meters: Root
- 7 or 8 meters: None

~Crystal Bolt~.Effect:
Attack a Unit exactly 6 meters away for 4d4 Crystal Damage.
The target and all Units within 1 meter of it also take Main Stat Crystal damage afterwards.

~Diamondize~.Effect:
Use when you would take damage.
Prevent the damage and become invulnerable and Stunned until the start of your next turn.
~Diamondize~.Notes: While invulnerable, you can not take damage and are immune to Crowd Control.

~Cutting Field~.Effect:
All units in a 90 degree, 6 meter long cone take 4d4 Crystal Damage.
Create spikes on all empty spaces (1x1 meter size each space).
Whenever a Unit steps on a spike space, it takes 1d4 Crystal Damage and shatters the spikes there.

<Spellcraft>.Effect:
When you cast a spell, you can apply this any of the following effects to it:
- For every 2 dice in its damage, roll 1 more
- If it targets an area, freely change the area to a 4x4 meter zone, 8x1 meter line or 5 meter 90* cone
- Change its damage type to any type, except True and Necrotic damage
- Change it's Check Stat to any other Stat (if it requires a Check)
- Swap Root, Cripple or Silence with any other of these
- Swap Slow, Prone or Pushing with any other of these (Push a target 2 meters away from you or from the zone center)
- Double its range
At any point, you can expend 1 Mana to reset the Cooldown of this Spell (Spellcraft).

~Artificer~.Effect:
You own a set of Artificer's Tools, with which you can create potions, scrolls and other items.
Some of your class spells require you to use your Artificer's Tools (described below).
If they require you to spend Mana, that Mana becomes locked and can't be regained through any means, until the item created is used or destroyed.
For 1 Action, you can summon or vanish your Artificer's Tools.
Furthermore, you can use your Artificer's Tools for 10 minutes to make items shed light, emmit a sound or smell or paint surfaces in rough images or writing. The magical effects last for up to 8 hours.
Feel free to be creative with what you can do - the tools might do other small artificer tasks as well. Ask your DM!
~Artificer~.Notes:
Spells noted as 'Artificer' require you to use Artificer's Tools.
If you ever lose your Artificer's Tools, the price for a new set is 200 gold.
As usual, items created this way require a Half-Action to use.
Artificer potions do not count towards the potion limit cooldown.
Artificer's Tools's small tasks are a non-combat. You can't use them to deal damage, crowd control or heal.

~Artificer - Magic Scroll~.Effect:
Choose a Spell you can cast and spend Mana for it if it requires Mana.
You create a scroll containing that spell.
~Artificer - Magic Scroll~.Notes:
Remember that scrolls always take a Half-Action to use and can be used by anyone, including non-spellcasters.
Mana spent for the spell inside the scroll when creating the scroll does become locked as well.

~Artificer - Magic Elixir~.Effect:
Choose one of the following types of potions and create it
o Elixir of Healing - Heal for 2d6 + 1.
o Elixir of Strength - Attacks with 2-Handed weapons deal +2 damage, and attacks with 1-Handed weapons deal +1 damage (lasts 2 combat encounters).
o Elixir of Agility - Doubled movement speed.
o Elixir of Mana - Gain 1 Mana (if the user does not have Mana-based spellcasting, it has no effect).

<Master Specialization>.Effect: You gain access to the Nature, Mysticism, Eldritch and Divine Ability Lists to Know Generic Abilities from.
<Master Specialization>.Notes: If a Spell requires a certain Level, you need that Level to Know it, as usual.

<Artificer - Magic Weapon>.Effect:
You conjure a special weapon out of magic.
Choose a type of weapon, and choose 2 of the following effects:
o +2 damage
o Damage can freely be converted to Fire/Cold/Shock (choose one)
o +2 meters move speed
o +5 health while wielding it
You can only have 1 Magic Weapon created at a time.
The Magic Weapon is automatically destroyed after 24 hours.

<Spellcraft>.Effect:
When you cast a spell, you can apply this any of the following effects to it:
- For every 2 dice in its damage, roll 1 more
- If it targets an area, freely change the area to a 4x4 meter zone, 8x1 meter line or 5 meter 90* cone
- Change its damage type to any type, except True and Necrotic damage
- Change it's Check Stat to any other Stat (if it requires a Check)
- Swap Root, Cripple or Silence with any other of these
- Swap Slow, Prone or Pushing with any other of these (Push a target 2 meters away from you or from the zone center)
- Double its range
At any point, you can expend 1 Mana to reset the Cooldown of this Spell (Artificer - Spellcraft).

<Artificer - Golem>.Effect:
Choose an empty 2x2 meter space and deploy a Golem there that lasts until the end of your next Long Rest.
Choose if it's made of Clay, Metal or Flesh. It has different Abilities based on its material. You can find the Golem's stats in the Pets section.
The first time you summon a Golem after a Long Rest, it costs 1 Mana. Then, every Golem you summon costs 1 Mana more than the previous.
<Artificer - Golem>.Notes: The Golem has 0 initiative, so it usually takes its turn last in combat.

<Artificer - Autoturret>.Effect:
Choose an element: Fire, Cold, Shock or Force.
Choose an empty space to deploy an Autoturret of that element.
On your turn, you can freely make one attack with each Autoturret for 1d4 direct damage that ignores Defense and all resistances.
It has 5 Health, 7 Defense and fails all Checks.
<Artificer - Autoturret>.Notes: Cover from the turrets is applied normally.

<Artificer - Grenade>.Effect:
Throw a grenade at a target 5x5x5 meter area.
Choose one of the following effects. It applies to all Units caught in the area.
- Units must pass a Might Check or be Stunned
- Units must pass a Dexterity Check or take 6d4 Smash, Pierce or Slash damage (you choose) and be knocked away from the center of the area to closest space outside of the edge of the area. If a unit passes, it only takes half of that damage.
- The grenade explodes at the start of your next turn and deals 4d8 + Main Stat Fire damage (against Defense).
<Artificer - Grenade>.Notes: Alternatively, you create the Grenade out of combat and give it to an ally to use. If you do this, only one Grenade can be thrown during a combat. A second grenade has no effect (since it's magical by nature and draws from your magic power). This is considered an attack.

<Artificer - Magic Armor>.Effect:
You magically enchant a piece of armor until your next Long Rest.
Choose 2 of the following effects to apply to it:
- +1 Defense
- Choose a damage type. Wearer takes only 50% damage from that type.
- +2 meters Movement Speed, and the wearer can freely jump up to 2 meters (up or ahead; this still uses Movement).
